references.paper_title: A survey for solving mixed integer programming via machine learning
references.reason: This paper provides a comprehensive overview of machine learning methods for solving mixed integer programming problems, which are relevant to the cryptographic problems tackled in the main paper.

references.paper_title: Machine learning methods in solving the boolean satisfiability problem
references.reason: This paper focuses on machine learning methods for solving Boolean satisfiability problems (SAT), which is directly relevant to the central theme of the main paper.

references.paper_title: Learning a SAT solver from single-bit supervision
references.reason: This is a seminal work introducing a neural SAT solver trained with single-bit supervision, which is a key approach compared to and improved upon in the main paper.

references.paper_title: G4satbench: Benchmarking and advancing sat solving with graph neural networks
references.reason: This paper presents a benchmark for SAT solvers based on graph neural networks, providing a context for evaluating the performance of the proposed CryptoANFNet.

references.paper_title: Predicting propositional satisfiability via end-to-end learning
references.reason: This paper explores end-to-end learning for solving SAT problems, which is a related approach that the authors compare their approach to in the paper.
